questions.question: 1. What does the Gross Calorific Value (GCV) represent in a bomb calorimeter experiment?

answers.a: a) Heat absorbed by the bomb walls only
answers.b: b) Energy lost due to incomplete combustion
answers.c: c) Total heat released per gram of fuel, including heat from condensation
answers.d: d) Heat used only for raising temperature of the sample

questions.question: Why is the bomb calorimeter referred to as a constant volume calorimeter?

answers.c: Because the combustion chamber is rigid and sealed
answers.d: Because the volume of water used remains the same
